description:
misc/vim: set noexpandtab on go filetype

With noexpandtab vim will always use tab indentation when editing go files, as recomended in effective go

messages.text:
Using tabs for indentation is not personal, is the go way.

It is reasonable to put a setting that does not vary on different
development environments in misc/vim. Every go developer should use
noexpandtab when writing go code in vim.

On Wed, Feb 29, 2012 at 2:01 PM, Francisco Souza
<franciscossouza@gmail.com> wrote:

> Using tabs for indentation is not personal, is the go way.
>
> It is reasonable to put a setting that does not vary on different
> development environments in misc/vim. Every go developer should use
> noexpandtab when writing go code in vim.

expandtab already defaults to off in Vim. If that's not true in your
environment, then it's your environment that should be changed.

Tabs in Go is indeed the preferred style, but I'm not interested in
forcing it on people who have explicitly avoided tabs by changing
their editor settings.


Dave.

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

I don't see any particular call to set this here. You can put that in
your own .vimrc, along with setting shiftwidth and tabstop.

On Wed, Feb 29, 2012 at 12:12 AM, David Symonds <dsymonds@golang.org> wrote:

>
> expandtab already defaults to off in Vim. If that's not true in your
> environment, then it's your environment that should be changed.
>

hmm you're right. I had not thought of that.

Tabs in Go is indeed the preferred style, but I'm not interested in
> forcing it on people who have explicitly avoided tabs by changing
